definition-item.definition-title: CRANES; LOAD-ENGAGING ELEMENTS OR DEVICES FOR CRANES, CAPSTANS, WINCHES, OR TACKLES ({specially adapted for lifting invalids A61G7/10;} rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms, braking or detent devices therefor B66D; specially adapted for nuclear reactors G21)

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for lifting patients or disabled persons
Devices for carrying objects by hand

section-body.paragraph-text: The following IPC groups are not used in this classification scheme.
Subject matter of these groups is classified in the following groups:
The scheme includes entry B66C23/54, for which no corresponding IPC exists. Subject matter should be given an IPC classification in B66C23/68

definition-item.definition-title: Load-engaging elements or devices attached to lifting or lowering gear of cranes or adapted for connection therewith for transmitting lifting forces to articles or groups of articles (fastening to cables or ropes F16G11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents should be classified in the lowest subgroup possible and only classified in higher groups if none of the subgroups is applicable. If necessary documents should be classified in multiple subgroups. All non-trivial technical features should be classified. Main groups should only be used when no appropriate subgroup exists.

definition-item.definition-title: by suction means {(suction cups for attaching purposes F16B47/00)}
{for handling bulk or bags}
{Circular shape}

section-body.paragraph-text: suction means with a circular shape

definition-item.definition-title: {Safety measures, e.g. sensors, duplicate functions}

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangements for ensuring correct vacuum level or preventing load from falling if vacuum is lost.

definition-item.definition-title: {Hand held}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the weight of the load is supported by the operator.

definition-item.definition-title: {Special lip configurations}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the edge of the suction cup has a particular arrangement, for example a shape.

definition-item.definition-title: {Multiple lifting units; More than one suction area}

section-body.paragraph-text: This group not used, devices classified in following two subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: {Separate cups}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the suction cups are separated from each other by the mounting and/or piping arrangement.

definition-item.definition-title: {Divided cups}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the suction cup is a single unit with separated vacuum areas.

definition-item.definition-title: {Operating and control devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: General control arrangements not covered by the following three subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: {for rotation}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for rotating the load being lifted.

definition-item.definition-title: {Venturi effect}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the vacuum is created using venturi or bernouilli principle.

definition-item.definition-title: {actuated by lifting action}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the action of lifting the device creates the vacuum between the load and the suction cup.

definition-item.definition-title: {Rectangular or square shape}

section-body.paragraph-text: suction means with a rectangular shape

definition-item.definition-title: {Other shapes, e.g. triangular or oval}

section-body.paragraph-text: Shapes which are neither circular nor rectangular or are non-planar.

definition-item.definition-title: {Single lifting units; Only one suction cup}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices with only a single vacuum area.

definition-item.definition-title: by magnetic means

table-column.paragraph-text: Lifting devices with both electromagnets and permanent magnets

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Permanent magnets for lifting or picking up

definition-item.definition-title: electromagnetic

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electromagnets for lifting or transporting magnetic material

definition-item.definition-title: Circuits therefor (for electromagnets in general H01F7/18)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: by mechanical means

section-body.paragraph-text: mechanical load engaging devices not covered by one of the following subgroups

definition-item.definition-title: {for containers (B66C1/223 and B66C1/663 take precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Connectors, e.g. twistlocks, for connecting a lifting device to a container

definition-item.definition-title: {for two or more containers end to end}
{for two or more containers side by side}
{Lifting beam permitting to depose a load through an opening}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the load support is not directly under the crane hook, to allow the load to be deposited to one side.

definition-item.definition-title: {for lifting engines}

section-body.paragraph-text: Load supporting devices for lifting engines.

table-column.paragraph-text: Manually movable cranes for lifting engines

definition-item.definition-title: {for lifting parts of wind turbines}

section-body.paragraph-text: Load supporting devices for wind turbine parts.

definition-item.definition-title: Slings comprising chains, wires, ropes, or bands; Nets (article side grippers suspended by ropes or chains from crane hooks B66C1/42)

section-body.paragraph-text: Slings not covered by one of the following subgroups.
Devices where a sling is suspended from a platform.

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices where a platform is suspended from a sling

definition-item.definition-title: {Sling or load protectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for protecting the sling from damage.

definition-item.definition-title: {Chain-type slings (chains in general F16G)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Lifting chains connecting the load to the lifting device

table-column.paragraph-text: Chains with hook for attaching to load

definition-item.definition-title: {Nets}
Slings with hooks

section-body.paragraph-text: Chains or slings with hooks to attach to load.

table-column.paragraph-text: Chains with hook for attaching to chain link to form a loop around load

definition-item.definition-title: Slings with load-engaging platforms or frameworks

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where a platform is suspended from a sling.

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices where a sling is suspended from a platform

definition-item.definition-title: Band-type slings

table-column.paragraph-text: Straps for attaching loads e.g. to trucks

definition-item.definition-title: specially adapted for handling vehicles
Rigid members, e.g. L-shaped members, with parts engaging the under surface of the loads; Crane hooks
{for containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Rigid lifting devices for lifting a container from below

definition-item.definition-title: {for flexible intermediate bulk containers [FIBC]}
Single members engaging the loads from one side only
with means for releasing the loads
Duplicate, e.g. pivoted, members engaging the loads from two sides
and also arranged to grip the sides of the loads
of piled or stacked articles
Crane hooks
with means, e.g. spring-biased detents, for preventing inadvertent disengagement of loads
adapted for automatic disengagement from loads on release of cable tensions (for parachutes {B64D17/00})

section-body.paragraph-text: Hooks where the load is automatically released when the load is lowered.

definition-item.definition-title: formed or fitted with load measuring or indicating devices
Gripping members engaging only the external or internal surfaces of the articles (for handling or stripping castings or ingots during manufacture B22D29/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Gripping members not relying on friction to hold load, e.g. where the shape of the device ensures sufficient hold.

definition-item.definition-title: {actuated by lifting force (B66C1/44, B66C1/58 take precedence)}
{motor actuated (B66C1/44, B66C1/58 take precedence)}
{by hydraulic or pneumatic motors}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices using fluid motors or cylinders.

definition-item.definition-title: and applying frictional forces

section-body.paragraph-text: Gripping members relying on friction to hold load.

definition-item.definition-title: {actuated by lifting force}
{motor actuated}
{by hydraulic or pneumatic motors}
by inflatable elements
to vertical edge portions of sheets, tubes, or like thin or thin-walled articles (internally-expanding grippers B66C1/54)
{Coil lifting devices}
Internally-expanding grippers for handling hollow articles (B66C1/46 takes precedence)
for handling tubes
and deforming the articles, e.g. by using gripping members such as tongs or grapples
{Log grapples}
Tongs for sacks
comprising article-engaging members of a shape complementary to that of the articles to be handled
{for gripping drums or barrels}

section-body.paragraph-text: devices gripping drums or barrels either by their body or edges

definition-item.definition-title: for T- or I-section beams or girders
for engaging holes, recesses, or abutments on articles specially provided for facilitating handling thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices such as lifting rings or pins lifting via holes in object being lifted

definition-item.definition-title: {for containers (fastening of containers on vehicles B60P7/13, B60P7/132)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices such as twistlocks, which connect a lifting device to a container

table-column.paragraph-text: Lifting devices per se such as spreaders for containers

definition-item.definition-title: {for connection to anchor inserts embedded in concrete structures}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: mounted on, or guided by, jibs (jibs B66C23/64)

section-body.paragraph-text: lifting devices mounted on a rigid arm, boom, jib etc. rather than suspended from a flexible element such as a cable or chain

definition-item.definition-title: {Grab supports, e.g. articulations; Oscillation dampers; Orientation (B66C3/16 takes precedence)}
Bucket grabs
Tine grabs
Grabs actuated by a single rope or chain

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where a single rope is used for both raising and subgroupsering and opening/closing.

definition-item.definition-title: and having tipping rings
and having buckets opening automatically upon the grab being lowered on to the dump of material
{Devices for control}
Grabs actuated by two or more ropes

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where separate ropes are used for raising and subgroupsering and opening/closing.

definition-item.definition-title: {Devices for control}
Grabs opened or closed by driving motors thereon

section-body.paragraph-text: Grabs operated other than by electric or hydraulic motors, e.g. magnets

definition-item.definition-title: by fluid motors
by electric motors
mounted on, or guided by, jibs (jibs B66C23/64)
Fixed or travelling bridges or gantries, i.e. elongated structures of inverted L or of inverted U shape {or tripods}
{Tripods}
with runways or tracks supported for movements relative to bridge or gantry
with runways or tracks supported for lateral swinging movements
with vertically invlinable runways or tracks
Portals, i.e. essentially circular or square platforms with three or more legs specially adapted for supporting slewing jib cranes
Girders, or track-supporting structures, specially adapted for cranes (base supporting structures with legs B66C5/00; girders in general E04C3/02)
for underhung trolleys or cranes
Trackway suspension
Constructional features of runway rails or rail mountings (of general application E01B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Details of rails, mountings, suspension etc.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements or devices for extending runways or tracks

section-body.paragraph-text: Extensions pivoted to or telescoped in end of track section.

table-column.paragraph-text: Similar track sections joined to each other

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for changing direction of travel or for transferring from one runway to another; Crossings; Combinations of tracks of different gauges (transfer devices of general application E01B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices on rails for allowing transfer.

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices on trolleys allowing transfer to other rail
Devices on trolleys allowing transfer to different gauge

definition-item.definition-title: Runway interlocking devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Similar track sections joined to each other.

table-column.paragraph-text: Extension parts with different section or pivoted /telescoping extensions

definition-item.definition-title: Devices specially adapted for limiting trolley or crane travel; Arrangements of buffer-stops (buffer-stops of interest apart from this application B61K7/18; limit-switch arrangements, limit circuits B66D1/56)
for underhung trolleys or cranes
to facilitate negotiation of curves

section-body.paragraph-text: Wheel arrangements for running around curves on rails.

definition-item.definition-title: for more than one rail gauge

section-body.paragraph-text: Trolleys adapted to run on different rails.

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices on rails for allowing transfer

definition-item.definition-title: Runners; Runner bearings (wheels for railbound vehicles B60B)
Undercarriages or bogies, e.g. end carriages, end bogies

section-body.paragraph-text: Bogies for end of bridge of overhead cranes or bogies for wheeled cranes.

definition-item.definition-title: with load-distributing means for equalising wheel pressure
Trolley or crane travel drives (rope, cable, or chain drives for loads or trolleys B66C11/16; control B66C13/18)
with means for maintaining alignment between wheels and track
with means for locking trolleys or cranes to runways or tracks to prevent inadvertent movements
with operating gear or operator's cabin suspended, or laterally offset, from runway or track
Underhung trolleys (power-operated hoists with driving motor and drum or barrel contained in a common housing B66D3/20)
running on monorails (overhead railway systems B61B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Smaller trolleys supported by a single rail.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with turntables
equipped with jibs (jib-cranes B66C23/00)
having hoisting gear adapted to special load-engaging elements and not otherwise provided for
adapted to operate on crane or bridge structure of particular configuration, e.g. on reinforced concrete girders of rectangular cross-section
Rope, cable, or chain drives for trolleys; Combinations of such drives with hoisting gear

table-column.paragraph-text: Drives for running gear, e.g. wheels

definition-item.definition-title: comprising endless ropes or cables

Arrangements, e.g. comprising differential gears, enabling simultaneous or selective operation of travelling and hoisting gear; Arrangements using the same rope or cable for both travelling and hoisting, e.g. in Temperley cranes (power transmissions between driving motors and winch drums B66D1/14)
actuated pneumatically or hydraulically
with means for locating or sustaining the loads or trolleys in predetermined positions; Hay hoists
Abutments; Stop blocks; End stops
{Cranes carrying advertisements or the like}

Devices for facilitating retrieval of floating objects, e.g. for recovering crafts from water (handling live-boats B63B; salvaging, or hauling-out on slipways, waterborne vessels B63C; winding mechanism controls B66D1/52)
Auxiliary devices for controlling movements of suspended loads, or preventing cable slack
for minimising or preventing longitudinal or transverse swinging of loads
{electrical}
{for minimising vibration of a boom}
for depositing loads in desired attitudes or positions

section-body.paragraph-text: Mechanical arrangements for accurate final load position or orientation.

definition-item.definition-title: {electrical}

section-body.paragraph-text: Electrical arrangements for accurate final load position or orientation.

definition-item.definition-title: for preventing cable slack (control devices for rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms, e.g. for controlling tensions, B66D1/40)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices to prevent cable from hanging loose, i.e. with no tension, by supporting or applying tension.

definition-item.definition-title: {electrical}

section-body.paragraph-text: Anti-slack devices using electrical control, e.g. limit switches or tension measurement.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of means for transmitting pneumatic, hydraulic, or electric power to movable parts of devices
to load-engaging elements or motors associated therewith

section-body.paragraph-text: Energy supply to load engaging elements, including local energy generation devices.

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of indicating, registering, or weighing devices (in crane hooks B66C1/40; in safety gear B66C15/00; weighing-apparatus G01G; remote indicating in general G08)

section-body.paragraph-text: Load measurement, either directly or indirectly, e.g. via motor torque.

table-column.paragraph-text: Load measurement in connection with safety control

definition-item.definition-title: Control systems or devices (exclusively for rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms B66D1/40)

section-body.paragraph-text: General control arrangements not fitting one of the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: for non-electric drives (transmitting control pulses B66C13/40)
for electric drives (transmitting control pulses B66C13/40; systems or devices of general application H02P)

table-column.paragraph-text: Controls for load lifting and lowering

definition-item.definition-title: Circuits for controlling the lowering of the load

section-body.paragraph-text: Control of crane lowering and lifting drives.

definition-item.definition-title: utilising regenerative braking for controlling descent of heavy loads and having means for preventing rotation of motor in the hoisting direction when load is released

section-body.paragraph-text: Crane drives with regeneration of energy when lowering.

definition-item.definition-title: Circuits for braking, traversing, or slewing motors

for operating grab bucket hoists by means of one or more electric motors used both for hosting and lowering the loads and for opening and closing the bucket jaws (other aspects or rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms specially adapted for actuating grab buckets B66D1/62)
Applications of devices for transmitting control pulses; Applications of remote control devices (control in general G05)

section-body.paragraph-text: Remote controls for cranes and winches, i.e. outside cabin, includes both hard wired and wireless units.

definition-item.definition-title: Hydraulic transmitters

section-body.paragraph-text: Control arrangements using hydraulic signal transmission, e.g. between sensor and central unit.

definition-item.definition-title: Electrical transmitters

section-body.paragraph-text: Control arrangements using electric signal transmission, e.g. between sensor and central unit.

definition-item.definition-title: Position indicators for suspended loads or for crane elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Sensors and cameras for detecting position of loads or parts of crane.

definition-item.definition-title: Automatic control of crane drives for producing a single or repeated working cycle; Programme control

section-body.paragraph-text: Systems allowing the crane to carry out an automatic movement, for example based on a program or target position, includes path planning and stack optimisation.

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of limit circuits or of limit-switch arrangements (for winding mechanisms B66D1/56)
Details of compartments for driving engines or motors or of operator's stands or cabins
Operator's stands or cabins

table-column.paragraph-text: Operator's compartments for fork lift trucks
Operator's compartments for soil shifting machines

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements of handles or pedals

section-body.paragraph-text: Control devices actuated by the operator.

definition-item.definition-title: Safety gear (for rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms B66D1/54)

section-body.paragraph-text: General crane safety devices not covered by one of the following subgroups

definition-item.definition-title: for retaining load-engaging elements in the event of rope or cable breakage
for preventing collisions, e.g. between cranes or trolleys operating on the same track
{electrical}
Arrangements or use of warning devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Non-electric devices, e.g. with visual indication

definition-item.definition-title: {electrical}
with lifting beams, e.g. slewable beams, carrying load-engaging elements, e.g. magnets, hooks (constructions of load-engaging elements B66C1/00, B66C3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices where the load carrying element is connected to the lifting beam, i.e. not suspended by cables.

definition-item.definition-title: specially adapted for particular purposes, e.g. in foundries, forges; combined with auxiliary apparatus serving particular purposes (B66C17/04 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Specially adapted devices, i.e. with particular mechanical features making them especially suitable for a particular application not covered by the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: for charging treatment chambers, e.g. furnaces, kilns, ovens (charging furnaces in general F27D3/00)
for transporting ladles

for handling workpieces, e.g. ingots, which require to be supported temporarily within, or withdrawn from, a treatment chamber, e.g. tong cranes, soaking-pit cranes, stripper cranes (for manipulating ingots during forging B66C17/18; grippers for handling or stripping castings or ingots during manufacture B22D29/00)
Tong cranes with means for moving article-pushers relative to the tongs
Tong cranes with means for turning the tongs about a vertical axis
for manipulating workpieces during forging operations (work-pieces manipulators in forging machines B21J13/10)
for hoisting or lowering heavy load carriers, e.g. freight containers, railway wagons
for hoisting or lowering locomotives
combined with auxiliary apparatus, e.g. log saws, pushers for unloading vehicles, means for shunting railway vehicles
Cranes comprising trolleys or crabs running on fixed or movable bridges or gantries (B66C17/00 takes precedence; base supporting structures with legs B66C5/00; jib cranes B66C23/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Gantry cranes not covered by the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: {Container cranes (B66C19/007 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Gantry cranes for containers, i.e. static cranes or cranes with wheels which are static when handling loads.

definition-item.definition-title: {Straddle carriers (B66C19/007 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Straddle carriers for loads other than containers, e.g. boats.

definition-item.definition-title: {for containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Straddle carriers for containers, i.e. wheeled devices which carry containers around ports.

definition-item.definition-title: collapsible {(B66C19/002, B66C19/005 takes precedence)}

Cable cranes, i.e. comprising hoisting devices running on aerial cable-ways (rope or cable drives for trolleys, combinations of such drives with hoisting gear B66C11/16; railway systems B61B; rope or cable winding mechanisms B66D1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices not falling into one of the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: with cable-ways supported on framework swingably connected to groundengaging elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Cable cranes where one support for the end of the cable is pivotable.

definition-item.definition-title: with cable-ways supported at one end or both ends on bodily movable framework, e.g. framework mounted on rail track

section-body.paragraph-text: Cable cranes where one end of the cable is not fixed.

definition-item.definition-title: with one end supported on a framework movable in a curved, e.g. circular, path and the other end by a column rotatable around a vertical axis
Sag carriers or rope trolleys, suspended or not, e.g. fixed but offering clearance for travelling gear
travelling

section-body.paragraph-text: Supports which are movable along the cable.

definition-item.definition-title: Cranes comprising essentially a beam, boom, or triangular structure acting as a cantilever and mounted for translatory of swinging movements in vertical or horizontal planes or a combination of such movements, e.g. jib-cranes, derricks, tower cranes (base supporting structures with legs B65C5/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Stationary cranes are classified in B66C23/00 - B66C23/24.
Tower type cranes (which may be mobile) are classified in B66C23/26 - B66C23/34.
Mobile cranes are classified in B66C23/36 and later subgroups.
Groups B66C23/54 onwards apply to all types of crane.

definition-item.definition-title: {with balanced jib, e.g. pantograph arrangement, the jib being moved manually}
with non-adjustable and non-inclinable jibs mounted solely for slewing movements

section-body.paragraph-text: Jib cranes with a fixed vertical column mounted on the ground as the sole support, with a jib mounted for slewing at the top of the column, i.e. the column does not rotate and the inclination of the jib can not be altered.

table-column.paragraph-text: Jib cranes where the column also rotates or the jib inclination can be altered
Jib cranes which are supported by other means, e.g. additional support from a building

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is only used if the following subgroups are not applicable. Documents may be classified in more than one subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: {Pivot axis common with column}

section-body.paragraph-text: Jibs pivoting around the centre of the column.

definition-item.definition-title: {with particular mounting for base of column}
{Pivot axis separated from column axis}

section-body.paragraph-text: Jibs whose pivot is not in line with the axis of the column.

definition-item.definition-title: with jibs the effective length of which is variable in operation, e.g. longitudinally displaceable, extensible

table-column.paragraph-text: Telescopic booms e.g. for mobile cranes

definition-item.definition-title: with jibs mounted for jibbing or luffing movements

section-body.paragraph-text: Fixed cranes with luffing jibs not covered by one of the subgroups B66C23/08 - B66C23/14.

definition-item.definition-title: and adapted to move the loads in predetermined paths

section-body.paragraph-text: Mechanical arrangements for following a particular non-horizontal path.

definition-item.definition-title: the paths being substantially horizontal; Level-luffing jib-cranes
with means for automatically varying the effective length of the hoisting rope or cable
with means, e.g. pantograph arrangements, for varying jib configuration
with jibs supported by columns, e.g. towers having their lower end mounted for slewing movements

section-body.paragraph-text: Jib cranes with a fixed vertical column mounted on the ground as the sole support, includes cranes with a jib mounted for slewing at the centre or bottom of the column, i.e. at least part of the column rotates. the jib may or may not be inclinable.

table-column.paragraph-text: Jib cranes with a jib mounted for slewing at the top of the column, i.e. the column does not rotate and the inclination of the jib can not be altered.
Jib cranes which are supported by other means, e.g. additional support from a building

definition-item.definition-title: {where only part of the column rotates, i.e. at least the bottom part is fixed}

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes where all the column is fixed

definition-item.definition-title: {Simple cranes with jibs which may be fixed or can slew or luff}
specially adapted for use in particular purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes with jibs for specific applications not covered by the following groups B66C23/20 - B66C23/52.

definition-item.definition-title: {for use erecting wind turbines (B66C23/207 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Load connecting element for lifting wind turbines
Cranes supported on or by wind turbines

definition-item.definition-title: with supporting couples provided by walls of buildings or like structures

section-body.paragraph-text: Jib cranes which are not supported only by a simple foot on the ground, but (also) by other means, e.g. additional support from a building, which do not fit one of the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: {with supporting couples provided from above, e.g. by ceilings of buildings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Supported either from only above or from both above and below.

definition-item.definition-title: {with supporting couples provided from below, e.g. by floors of buildings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes supported only from below, but requiring extra support, i.e. not merely mounted by a simple crane foot.

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes supported both from below and above

definition-item.definition-title: {with supporting couples provided by posts, e.g. scaffolding, trees or masts}
{for use on top of roofs}
{with supporting couples provided by iso containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes mounted on or in containers

definition-item.definition-title: {with supporting couples provided by wind turbines}

section-body.paragraph-text: Mounted on or supported by wind turbines or for erecting wind turbines.

table-column.paragraph-text: Load connecting element for lifting wind turbines
Cranes not supported by the wind turbine

definition-item.definition-title: {with supporting couples provided from the side, e.g. by walls of buildings}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes fixed to walls, i.e. which do not move relative to the wall.

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes which can run along walls

definition-item.definition-title: Window cranes, i.e. adapted to be supported in window openings
Mobile wall cranes

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes with a jib which runs along a wall.

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes fixed to walls, i.e. which do not move relative to the wall

definition-item.definition-title: for use on building sites; constructed, e.g. with separable parts, to facilitate rapid assembly or dismantling, for operation at successively higher levels, for transport by road or rail (with supporting couples provided by walls or buildings B66C23/20; mounted on vehicles B66C23/36; jib constructions B66C23/64)

section-body.paragraph-text: Tower type cranes not fitting one of the subgroups B66C23/28 - B66C23/34.

definition-item.definition-title: constructed to operate at successively higher levels

section-body.paragraph-text: Tower cranes where the jib does not have a fixed tower height relative to the ground and do not fit the following two subgroups.

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes where the tower is telescopic

definition-item.definition-title: {with frameworks composed of assembled elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes which have towers which can be extended by adding an extra section to the tower.

definition-item.definition-title: {with locking devices}
with frameworks composed of telescopic elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes which have towers which can be extended by a telescoping section of the tower.

definition-item.definition-title: {with locking devices}
Self-hoisting cranes

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes which can alter the height of the jib and top of tower by climbing up other structures.

definition-item.definition-title: Self-erecting cranes, i.e. with hoisting gear adapted for crane erection purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes which can assemble or erect themselves into their working configuration, not falling into one of the following four subgroups.

table-column.paragraph-text: Mobile cranes with arrangements for assembling and lifting the boom from the ground.

definition-item.definition-title: {with telescopic elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes which erect by extending a telescopic section.

definition-item.definition-title: {adapted for transport purposes}

section-body.paragraph-text: Where the arrangement relates specifically to transport of the crane, i.e. not merely to folding the tower and jib to the horizontal position.

definition-item.definition-title: {with locking devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes with devices for locking the elements into their operating or transport positions.

definition-item.definition-title: {the erection being operated by jacks}

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes where the erecting mechanism uses jacks instead of for example winches and cables.

definition-item.definition-title: mounted on road or rail vehicles; Manually-movable jib-cranes for use in workshops; Floating cranes (with pneumatic or hydraulic motors B66C23/54; vehicle or ship aspects B60 - B63)

section-body.paragraph-text: Vehicle mounted cranes not fitting one of the subgroups B66C23/38 – B66C23/545.

definition-item.definition-title: {dismantable into smaller units for transport purposes}
with separate prime movers for crane and vehicle

section-body.paragraph-text: Mobile cranes with more than one engine, e.g. where the engine driving the crane lifting functions is not used for propelling the crane along a road.

definition-item.definition-title: with a single prime mover for both crane and vehicle

section-body.paragraph-text: Where the same engine is used for driving the lifting functions and wheels or tracks.

definition-item.definition-title: with jibs of adjustable configuration, e.g. foldable

section-body.paragraph-text: Mobile cranes with telescopic or extendable jibs, or jibs which change configuration during operation.

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes with jibs which are folded for transport using cylinders.

definition-item.definition-title: Jib-cranes adapted for attachment to standard vehicles, e.g. agricultural tractors

section-body.paragraph-text: Vehicle mounted cranes, i.e. mounted on a normal vehicle rather than a mobile crane where the chassis is specially constructed for a crane.
pipe laying cranes where a boom is mounted to one side of a wheeled or tracked chassis.
See for example US 6 138 991 or US 7 600 646

definition-item.definition-title: Mobile jib-cranes with non-slewable jibs
Manually-movable jib cranes for use in workshops

section-body.paragraph-text: Small cranes on wheels which can be moved around manually or have simple drives.

definition-item.definition-title: {for lifting and moving engines, e.g. car or aero engines or parts thereof}

table-column.paragraph-text: Load connecting element for lifting engines

definition-item.definition-title: mounted on railway vehicles, e.g. breakdown cranes
Floating cranes (floating dredgers E02F)

section-body.paragraph-text: Cranes mounted on a ship or other floating structure.

definition-item.definition-title: {Double slewing cranes on ships}

table-column.paragraph-text: Cranes with double jibs mounted on land

definition-item.definition-title: including counterweight or means to compensate for list, trim, or skew of the vessel or platform (counterweights or supports for balancing lifting couples B66C23/72; equipment to decrease unwanted vessel movements B63B39/00)
{with pneumatic or hydraulic motors, e.g. for actuating jib-cranes on tractors}

section-body.paragraph-text: Jib cranes with hydraulic cylinders, e.g. for folding jib for transport.
No corresponding IPC exists. Subject matter should be given an IPC classification in B66C23/68

definition-item.definition-title: {with arrangements for avoiding dead centre problems during cylinder motion}
arranged to carry out a desired sequence of operations automatically, e.g. hoisting followed by luffing and slewing
Derricks
{employing ships' masts (B66C23/525 takes precedence)}
Jibs

section-body.paragraph-text: Construction of jibs not covered by the following subgroups, e.g. non-telescopic jibs.

definition-item.definition-title: Outer or upper end constructions
foldable or otherwise adjustable in configuration
constructed of sections adapted to be assembled to form jibs or various lengths
{telescopic}

section-body.paragraph-text: Telescoping actuator arrangements with a combination of actuators, e.g. by both cables and cylinders.

definition-item.definition-title: {with a jib extension boom}
{telescoped by flexible elements, e.g. cables, chains or bands}

table-column.paragraph-text: Telescoping arrangements using both cables and cylinders

definition-item.definition-title: {telescoped by hydraulic jacks}

table-column.paragraph-text: Telescoping arrangements using both cables and cylinders

definition-item.definition-title: {telescoped by other means}
{guiding devices for telescopic jibs}
{locking devices for telescopic jibs}

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangements to lock the telescopic sections in a particular position.

definition-item.definition-title: Counterweights or supports for balancing lifting couples

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: separate from jib

section-body.paragraph-text: Static counterweights not associated with jib.

table-column.paragraph-text: Movable counterweights not associated with jib

definition-item.definition-title: and movable to take account of variations of load or of variations of length of jib

section-body.paragraph-text: Movable counterweights not associated with jib.

definition-item.definition-title: Supports, e.g. outriggers, for mobile cranes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: hydraulically actuated
Luffing gear

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for luffing the jib, including for erection purposes.

table-column.paragraph-text: Self erecting cranes, e.g. tower cranes

definition-item.definition-title: {Bracing equipment for booms}

section-body.paragraph-text: Bracing equipment to support bending load on the jib or boom, not covered by one of the following subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: {Bracing equipment acting in vertical direction}
{Bracing equipment acting in horizontal direction}
{Bracing equipment acting at an inclined angle to vertical and horizontal directions}
{where the angle is adjustable}
Slewing gear (anti-friction bearings F16C)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for slewing the upper works or boom of a crane.

definition-item.definition-title: hydraulically actuated

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices for slewing the upper works or boom of a crane using hydraulic motors or cylinders.

definition-item.definition-title: Safety gear (for cranes in general B66C15/00; for rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms B66D1/54)

section-body.paragraph-text: Safety gear for boom cranes not covered by one of the subgroups B66C23/90 - B66C23/94.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for indicating or limiting lifting moment
{electrical}
Snubbers or dashpots for preventing backwards swinging of jibs, e.g. in the event of cable or tackle breakage
for limiting slewing movements
